links.title: Trump steps up Syria rhetoric, says 'something should happen' with Assad
links.description: ABOARD AIR FORCE ONE/WASHINGTON U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday that "something should happen" with President Bashar al-Assad after a poison gas attack in Syria, as the Pentagon and the White House launched detailed discussions on military options.

links.title: Here's one reason to be bearish on Tesla
links.description: By Tesla Inc., the No. 2 U.S. car maker by market value, seems unstoppable for now. Tesla shares pierced the $300 mark on Tuesday, hitting an intraday record of $304.81 and a closing record of $303.70. The stock's surge put Tesla's market capitalization ahead of Ford's and a stone's throw behind General Motors'.

links.title: U.S. launches cruise missile strike on Syria after chemical weapons attack
links.description: CLOSE WASHINGTON - President Trump ordered a cruise missile strike against Syria early Friday local time in retaliation for the chemical weapons attack that killed 86 people on Tuesday, according to media reports. The attack, the first conventional assault on another country ordered by Trump, comes a day after he declared that the chemical weapons assault had "crossed many, many lines," including the deaths of 27 children.

links.title: Why Tesla, Inc. Stock Jumped 11.3% in March -- The Motley Fool
links.description: Daniel Sparks owns shares of Tesla. The Motley Fool owns shares of and recommends Tesla. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy. In March, shares of electric-car maker ( Tesla NASDAQ:TSLA) continued their recent upward momentum. The stock gained 11.3% during the month, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.
